snippet: Majid Khan pleaded guilty in a deal requiring him to testify against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, and other accused terrorists.
abstract: Majid Khan, American member of Al Qaeda held at Guantanamo Bay, pleads guilty to numerous terrorism-related charges in a deal requiring him to testify against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the architect of the Sept 11, 2001 attacks, and other terrorism suspects.
lead_paragraph: Majid Khan pleaded guilty in a deal requiring him to testify against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, and other accused terrorists.

headline.seo: Majid Khan Pleads Guilty to Terrorism Plots in Military Court
headline.main: Testimony on Al Qaeda Is Required in Plea Deal
headline.print_headline: Testimony On Al Qaeda Is Required In Plea Deal
